text:
42F OSH transer with severe lupus with
   cryoglobulinemia vasculitis (on Cellcept, Prednisone, recently being tx
   for a flare), CAD 3VD s/p multiple MI's and stenting (EF 20%) s/p V Fib
   arrest (date unknown) with AICD, trace MR, chronic pain (on Methadone)
   that presents altered mental status and hypoxia. At the OSH the patient
   remained delerious and confused noted to be "rhyming words". OSH team
   felt believed some of her symptoms may have been secondary to narcotic
   and/or benzo withdrwal (as evidence by flushing and diaphoresis) and
   thus, she was also receiving Morphine IV and Valium q6H. Given a
   concern of sepsis in a patient with MS changes and tachycardia the pt
   was given Vancomycin 1gm IVx1 and Zosyn 3.375mg IVx1 on [**2108-12-23**]
   (nursing report listed Cefepime 2gm IV however no record seen in med
   rec). The pt remained afebrile while at [**Hospital3 519**] with all
   cultures NGTD. In addition the pt's prednisone was changed to
   Methylprednisolone 125mg IV q8H (unclear if pt received dose).
   Altered mental status (not Delirium)
   Assessment:
   Pt was agitated on and off today alternating with becoming nearly
   unresponsive.  After 10mg of IV valium she would often wake up, tell me
   where she was and that it was [**2108-12-14**], she admitted to pain and
   anxiety.  Through the day her resp rate cont to increase up to 60/min
   with periods of apnea
   Action:
   Given intermittand doses of valium, morphine, and dilaudid  but not
   nearly the benzo and narcotic use she had at home.  She was seen by
   neurology, EEG done, finally intubated for tachypnea and to allow us to
   do an LP and place a new CL.
   Response:
   Pt is sedated on fent and versed
   Plan:
   Will need to have her sedation decreased to follow her MS, follow for
   withdraw of benzos and narcotics
   Tachycardia, Other
   Assessment:
   Pt with a HR of 160 this am, pt agitated
   Action:
   Given 5 mg of lopressor x2 and 10 mg of valium, cardiac echo was done
   Response:
   Her HR decreased to the 120s after these meds but it did not last.
   After she was intubated and sedated her HR decreased to the low 120s
   Plan:
   Cont to follow
   Systemic Lupus Erythematosus (SLE)
   Assessment:
   Pt with  known severe lupus, vasculitis
   Action:
   Response:
   Plan:
   Peripheral vascular disease (PVD) with critical limb ischemia
   Assessment:
   Action:
   Response:
   Plan:
   Pain control (acute pain, chronic pain)
   Assessment:
   Action:
   Response:
   Plan:
   Coagulopathy
   Assessment:
   Action:
   Response:
   Plan:
